    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close(INode n)
        To be called when the node object is not closing though end of simulation or other termination condition. Current implementation prints a structure report.
        Parameters:
        n - The INode implementing object to close.

      • considerMining

        private void considerMining(long time)
        Considers whether to start or stop mining based on the current conditions, via consulting isWorthMining(). If it is determined to be worth mining, the method starts mining and schedules a new validation event. If it is not worth mining, the method stops mining and invalidates any future validation event.
        Parameters:
        time - The simulation time at which consideration is taking place

      • event_NodeCompletesValidation

        public void event_NodeCompletesValidation(ITxContainer t,
                                          long time)
        Handles the event when a node completes block validation (i.e., solves the hashcash problem. This method is called when a block has finished validation. The method performs the following steps: 1. Adds validation information to the block by invoking the Block.validateBlock(java.util.ArrayList, long, long, int, String, double, double) method on the block object. 3. Calls the Node.event_NodeCompletesValidation(ITxContainer, long) method on the superclass to handle additional validation logic. 4. Reports the validation event by invoking BitcoinReporter.reportBlockEvent(long, long, int, int, int, int, String, String, double, double). 5. Checks if the block is not already present in the blockchain. If it's not, adds the block to the blockchain structure and propagates it to the rest of the network. 6. If the block is already present in the blockchain, reports an error indicating the block is being discarded. This shouldn't occur in the simulation. 7. Stops the mining process temporarily. 8. Resets the next validation event. 9. Removes the block's transactions from the mining pool. 10. Reconstructs the mining pool with any remaining transactions. 11. Considers whether it is worth continuing mining.
        Specified by:
        event_NodeCompletesValidation in interface INode
        Overrides:
        event_NodeCompletesValidation in class Node
        Parameters:
        t - The transaction container that completed validation (expected to be a Block object).
        time - The simulation time of the completion event.

      • event_NodeReceivesClientTransaction

        public void event_NodeReceivesClientTransaction(Transaction t,
                                                long time)
        Handles the event when a node receives a client transaction. Calls transactionReceipt(Transaction, long) and Node.propagateTransaction(Transaction, long).
        Parameters:
        t - The transaction received.
        time - The current simulation time.

      • event_NodeReceivesPropagatedContainer

        public void event_NodeReceivesPropagatedContainer(ITxContainer t)
        Handles the event when a node receives a propagated container (i.e., a block validated by some other miner). If the block's transactions are not included in any transaction in the blockchain: update the context information for reporting, report the block event, attempt to add the block to the blockchain (may end up orphan or stale), remove the block transactions from the pool, reconstructs the mining pool, and consider starting or stopping mining based on the current conditions. If there is an ovelap between block's transactions and blockchain, discard the block and report the event.
        Parameters:
        t - The propagated Block received.

      • event_NodeReceivesPropagatedTransaction

        public void event_NodeReceivesPropagatedTransaction(Transaction t,
                                                    long time)
        Handles the event when a node receives a propagated transaction. This method checks if the transaction is not already in the Node's pool and not contained in the blockchain. If these conditions are met, the transaction is processed using the transactionReceipt(Transaction, long) method.
        Specified by:
        event_NodeReceivesPropagatedTransaction in interface INode
        Overrides:
        event_NodeReceivesPropagatedTransaction in class Node
        Parameters:
        t - The propagated transaction received.
        time - The current time when the event occurs.

        public TransactionGroup getMiningPool()
        Retrieves the mining pool associated with this instance.
        Returns:
        The mining pool.

      • getMinSizeToMine

        public long getMinSizeToMine()
        Retrieves the minimum size (in bytes) that the mining block must be for mining to be worthwhile.
        Returns:
        The minimum size required for mining.

      • getMinValueToMine

        public long getMinValueToMine()
        Retrieves the minimum value (in token currency) that the mining block must contain for mining to be worthwhile.
        Returns:
        The minimum value required for mining.

      • getOperatingDifficulty

        public double getOperatingDifficulty()

      • getStructure

        public IStructure getStructure()
        Retrieves the blockchain structure associated with this instance.
        Returns:
        The blockchain structure.

      • isWorthMining

        public boolean isWorthMining()
        Determines if it is worth mining based on the current mining pool value and the minimum value required for mining.
        Returns:
        true if it is worth mining (current value exceeds minimum value), false otherwise.

      • periodicReport

        public void periodicReport()
        Generates a time advancement report. This method is typically called fixed amount of simulation time defined by sim.reporting.window. This method should be implemented to provide the specific functionality required for the report. It is marked as an override method.

      • reconstructMiningPool

        private void reconstructMiningPool()
        Reconstructs the mining pool with the most valuable subset of pool transactions that can fit within maximum block size set in bitcoin.maxBlockSize. The transaction evaluation is performed by ranking pool transaction based on value per size. [Ideal solution would be a knapsack algorithm.] This method does not have any return value.

      • setMiningPool

        public void setMiningPool(TransactionGroup miningPool)
        Sets the mining pool for this instance.
        Parameters:
        miningPool - The mining pool to be set.

      • setMinSizeToMine

        public void setMinSizeToMine(long minSizeToMine)
        Sets the minimum size (in bytes) that the mining block must be for mining to be worthwhile.
        Parameters:
        minSizeToMine - The minimum size required for mining to be set.

      • setMinValueToMine

        public void setMinValueToMine(long minValueToMine)
        Sets the minimum value (in token currency) that the mining block must contain for mining to be worthwhile.
        Parameters:
        minValueToMine - The minimum value required for mining to be set.

        public void setOperatingDifficulty(double dif)

        public void setOperatingDifficulty(java.lang.Double operatingDifficulty)
        Sets the operating difficulty for this instance.
        Parameters:
        operatingDifficulty - The operating difficulty to be set. Measured as a (Search Space) / (Success Space) factor.

      • setStructure

        public void setStructure(Blockchain blockchain)
        Sets the blockchain structure for this instance.
        Parameters:
        blockchain - The blockchain structure to be set.

      • timeAdvancementReport

        public void timeAdvancementReport()
        Generates a time advancement report. This method is typically called every time simulation time advances, i.e. at the processing of each event. This method should be implemented to provide the specific functionality required for the report. It is marked as an override method.

      • transactionReceipt

        private void transactionReceipt(Transaction t,
                                long time)
        Processes a transaction receipt from a client by adding the transaction to the pool, reconstructing the mining pool, and considering whether to start or stop mining based on the new miningpool.
        Parameters:
        t - The transaction to process.
        time - The current simulation time.
